isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - REPLACE ENGINE WITH SERVICE ENGINE (V-8)

wtsproc.config: This vehicle is equipped with air conditioning.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Disconnect batteries.
Remove front bumper.
Remove hood -- includes: disconnect wiring harness, support cables, and pivot pins.
Drain cooling system.
Drain engine oil.
Remove charge air pipes and air filter/pipe assembly.
Evacuate A/C system, if applicable.
Disconnect the following hoses and lines: A/C condenser lines at condenser, all cooling system hoses at radiator, and power steering hoses at pump and reservoir.

Remove radiator/charge air cooler assembly -- includes: removal of clamps, support brackets, upper and lower radiator support struts, and connection of overhead lifting device to lift radiator assembly from chassis.
Remove fan/clutch assembly.
Remove fan/clutch pulley bolts; remove serpentine belt and fan pulley.
Disconnect wires from alternator; remove alternator.
Remove bolts retaining A/C compressor mounting bracket to engine; secure A/C compressor and bracket to air filter mounting bracket.
Disconnect fuel line hoses at filter; disconnect upper/lower radiator hoses and heater hoses from engine.
Disconnect all wiring necessary to remove engine from chassis -- includes: wiring to transmission, all support clamps and brackets, and time to mark wiring for re-installation.
Disconnect vacuum hose, high oil pressure line and exhaust pipe at turbo.
Close fuel valve, disconnect fuel line at fuel tank and cap ends, and remove fuel crossover support brace at fuel tanks for access.
Remove transmission shift stick cover boot.
Remove transmission shift tower from top of transmission.
Disconnect prop shaft at front carrier bearing and transmission; support and secure prop shaft to one side.
Disconnect emergency brake cable and clutch linkage arm from transmission.
Remove all transmission bolts except for two (2); remove clutch inspection cover.
Position and install transmission jack to transmission.
Remove two remaining transmission bolts; remove transmission from rear of engine.
Remove fuel filter assembly.
Remove air intake y-pipe at air intake plenum.
Remove front and rear engine mount bolts.
Install overhead lifting device and remove engine from chassis (two people).

With the new engine positioned near the engine being replaced, transfer the following: clutch, fittings, alternator, chassis wiring harness, air compressor, optional sensors (the sensors required for engine operation are provided with the service engine), and starter.
Install overhead lifting device and position new engine into chassis (two people).
Install motor mount bolts and secure engine to mounts; torque to spec.
Position and install transmission.
Connect prop shaft and torque to spec.
Install air intake y-pipe.
Install fuel filter assembly.
Connect emergency brake cable and clutch linkage arm to transmission.
Install transmission shift tower to top of transmission.
Install transmission shift stick cover boot.
Connect fuel line at fuel tank and open valve.
Connect vacuum hose, high oil pressure line and exhaust pipe at turbo.
Connect all wiring necessary to install engine to chassis -- includes: wiring to transmission, all support clamps and brackets.
Connect fuel line hoses at filter, as well as upper and lower radiator hoses and heater hoses to engine.
Install A/C compressor and bracket to engine, if applicable.
Install alternator and connect wires.
Install fan drive pulley and serpentine drive belt.
Install fan/clutch assembly.

Install radiator/charge air cooler assembly. -- includes: installation of clamps, support brackets, upper and lower radiator support struts, and connection of overhead lifting device to lift radiator assembly from chassis.
Connect the following hoses and lines: A/C condenser lines at condenser, all cooling system hoses at radiator, and power steering hoses at pump and reservoir.
Install charge air pipes and air filter/pipe assembly.
Fill engine oil.
Fill cooling system.
Charge A/C system, if applicable.
Bleed power steering system.
Install hood.
Install front bumper.
Connect batteries.
Start engine and check for leaks.
Remove wheel chocks.
Test drive.
